Definition: In this task, you will be given a negotiation between two participants. You will need to answer 'Yes' if both participants agree to the deal, otherwise answer 'No'.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.input: THEM: i need the hats and the ball  YOU: i can give you one hat and the ball. i want 2 books and 1 hat  THEM: i have to have both hats and the ball or both hats and a book to make a deal  YOU: sorry, i won`t make a deal without a hat  THEM: if you take 1 hat i have to have everything else  YOU: sorry can`t do  THEM: no deal  YOU: yesh no deal, sorry  THEM: no deal  YOU: no deal.
Positive Examples.explanation: Both participants do not agree to the deal, so the answer is No.

Positive Examples.input: THEM: hi i would like the book and ball and you can have the hats  YOU: i can give you either the book or the ball  THEM: ill take the book  YOU: ok i will take the hats and ball  THEM: deal.
Positive Examples.explanation: Both participants agree to the deal, so the answer is Yes.

Negative Examples.input: THEM: lemme get that book and ball!  YOU: i need 2 balls and a hat  THEM: i'll take the book and two hats then?  YOU: ok.
Negative Examples.explanation: Both participants agree to the deal, so the correct answer is Yes.

Negative Examples.input: THEM: hello. i would like the book and one ball.  YOU: you can have one ball 1 hat  THEM: i need the book or it's no deal.  YOU: no deal i am keeping the book  THEM: ok no deal  YOU: okay sounds good  THEM: alright  YOU: okay  THEM: alright no deal  YOU: okay its no deal.
Negative Examples.explanation: Both participants do not agree to the deal, so the correct answer is No.

Instances.input: THEM: i would like 2 books, you can have the rest  YOU: ok deal.

THEM: i'd like the ball and the books ; are the hats of any value to you?  YOU: could you trade a hat for the ball?  THEM: ball is the highest value item. ; the only way i can get rid of the ball is for everything else on the table.  YOU: ok, well books aren't worth anything for me so i'll take just the hats  THEM: kind of figured that, compromising isn't fun sometimes : ) - - if you're ok with that i do appreciate it.  YOU: no worries, this works for me.

THEM: i would like all the balls and any 2 items of your choosing.  YOU: how about all hats for you and i keep the rest  THEM: so 3 balls and the book for me? i'm ok with that.  YOU: i m not ok  THEM: i need all the balls and 1 other item then.  YOU: hat  THEM: ok. 3 balls and 1 hat for me?  YOU: no  THEM: no deal then.  YOU: yeah no deal.
THEM: i would like both balls and the hat, you can have the books.  YOU: sounds great! deal!  THEM: deal!
THEM: hi i would like the hat and balls, you can have the books  YOU: could i take the hat and a book?  THEM: ok, i can do that.
THEM: ill keep the ball you can have eveything else  YOU: deal.

THEM: if i can have the hat and the ball you can have the books  YOU: i need everthing  THEM: okay, that will not happen. you can have the books  YOU: i want the hat and ball  THEM: i need the same. let's split the difference you can have the ball and one book and i will take the hat and two books  YOU: just give me the hat  THEM: i need the hat i can not give it up  YOU: sounds like no deal bub  THEM: no deal.  YOU: no deal her.

THEM: ball and hats  YOU: only hats i get the rest  THEM: ball or no deal  YOU: you get the hats and i get the ball and books  THEM: ball or no deal  YOU: you get the hats and i get the ball and books  THEM: ball or no deal  YOU: sorry no deals  THEM: no deal then, keep chat rolling  YOU: sorry ill give you one hat and the ball and one book  THEM: ok deal  YOU: sorry no deal  THEM:?
